summary: This bill, the Empowering Parents’ Healthcare Choices Act, amends the Public Health Service Act, the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974, and the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. It allows parents to choose the primary health insurance coverage for their dependent children when both parents have separate health insurance policies or group health plans offering coverage. The bill specifies the process for electing primary coverage and the circumstances under which the primary coverage would cease. The amendments apply to children born on or after January 1, 2026.
